founder.name: Kamanda Collins
founder.title: Founder
founder.background: Final-year Petroleum and Mineral Geoscience student at Nkumba University

use_of_funds: Pay for NEMA legal review and formal environmental validation
Cover basic tech operations (internet, computer maintenance)
Convert pilot users into paid subscriptions by Q4 2025

key_metrics: Multiple outreach responses from environmental consultant network
Tools deployed and active at nema.kamandalabs.me
Uganda Clays accepted pilot letter and project proposal
Rwenzori Green and NEMA expressed interest in advising

problem_solution.problem_statement: ESIA wetland mapping delays averaging 21-28 days, with 34 mining/infrastructure projects stalled yearly in Uganda
problem_solution.solution_description: Automated environmental-compliance platform that slashes ESIA preparation time from 4 weeks to 3 days
unique_advantage: Founder-Builder-User: Geoscientist, developer, and early tester
Offline-friendly tech built for Ugandan connectivity realities
No competitors offering auto-generated Word+PNG+Markdown reports
Tied to national needs: NEMA compliance, extractives growth

executive_summary: KamandaLabs is Uganda's first automated environmental-compliance platform, built by Kamanda Collins — a final-year Petroleum and Mineral Geoscience student at Nkumba University — to slash ESIA preparation time from 4 weeks to 3 days. While we currently have no revenue, we have strong traction with 1 highly engaged consulting lead, multiple outreach responses, and tools already deployed. We are seeking $7,500 in non-dilutive funding.

roadmap_6_months.Month 1: Final pilot client - Full field use, paid test
roadmap_6_months.Month 2: NEMA lawyer engagement - Legal compliance report
roadmap_6_months.Month 3: Feature upgrade (alerts, UI) - Integrated WhatsApp/SMS reminders
